title.narrative: Digital Rights: Improving Human Rights Online in Jordan

description.narrative: Awareness​: To promote human rights through online outlets, focusing on raising broad-based awareness on digital risks and best practices for the protection of internet users and their rights, including activists and CSOs. Capacity​: To increase adoption of privacy enhancing tools, build capacities for digital resilience through innovative approaches and to support governmental efforts in digital rights. Help​: To provide incident response, digital security advice, and implementation support for CSOs and individuals at risk around Jordan. Monitoring​: Enhance knowledge, practice and partnerships for digital rights. Network and Localization​: Enhance sustainability of effort, response and advocacy for digital rights in Jordan.

Internet users and civil society organizations (CSOs) that require additional protection: 1.women and minors. 2.persons at risk for their political activities, e.g. human rights defenders, bloggers and activists. 3.sexual and religious minorities.

recipient-country.narrative: All Activities will be implemented in Jordan

title.narrative: Promotion of digital rights through online outlets

Pages translated from English to Arabic and vise versa

title.narrative: Supporting governmental efforts in digital rights

description.narrative: Continuous support to the Ministry of Digital Economy and Entrepreneurship when it comes to digital rights in Jordan. Drafting the Open Data Quality Framework; the framework outlays a systematic method to assess the viability of publishing datasets on the open government data portal and rate their quality. The ministry shared all important considerations for the framework, and JOSA took charge of redacting the Open Government Data Quality Framework. In such cases, JOSA is placed in a very good position to affect public policy in accordance with global digital rights principles. Providing 3 workshops on Open Data to over 65 government bodies, to help them start publishing open datasets. Within these workshops, we explained what is open data and its projected benefits. Also, we offered some exercises related to metadata and open formats and concluded the workshops with important considerations for open data quality.
Workshops to promote digital rights and their related tools/techniques in public entities.

comment.narrative: Workshops to promote digital rights and their related tools/techniques in public entities.
Workshops to promote digital rights and their related tools/techniques in public entities.
Workshops to promote digital rights and their related tools/techniques in public entities.

title.narrative: Drafting and publishing of at least 3 frameworks/procedures/standards to be implemented by public administration.

description.narrative: Provide legal and technical assistance for the implementation of governmental standards, frameworks and policies to allow citizens free and participatory information access.

comment.narrative: Draft of a policy framework
Draft of a policy framework

description.narrative: Identified civil society organisations to target in the next year. We also worked extensively on adapting the SafeTag digital security auditing framework to the local context. SafeTag is a framework specific to CSOs and so we saw a great benefit in adopting it. We also selected another framework called CyberStar which we will use for smaller audits, specifically CSOs with minimal IT infrastructure. We also ran mock audits on both frameworks in order to ensure the team is ready come year 2.
Creation and localization of digital security assessment framework to be implemented for local CSOs.

comment.narrative: A digital risk assessment framework
A digital risk assessment framework

description.narrative: Publication of research findings related to local digital rights issues, as reports, policy recommendations and other forms of publications.
Output in the form of a technical report or policy paper

Participation in public consultations by the ministry of digital economy and entrepreneurship regarding ICT policies

description.narrative: Started gathering interest from people wanting to join our CryptoJOSA team. We have started to identify and invite speakers for CryptoParties however they were delayed due to restrictions brought on by COVID-19. Potential speakers include: a contributor to the DP3T protocol for private proximity tracing and a core developer of SecureDrop a platform for whistleblowers to communicate anonymously with news organisations.

title.narrative: started to identify and invite speakers for CryptoParties however they were delayed due to restrictions brought on by COVID-19. Potential speakers include: a contributor to the DP3T protocol for private proximity tracing and a core developer of SecureDrop a platform for whistleblowers to communicate anonymously with news organisations.

comment.narrative: Started a community of people passionate and knowledgeable about privacy-enhancing tools and encryption
Started a community of people passionate and knowledgeable about privacy-enhancing tools and encryption

description.narrative: worked at length to establish a digital helpline process for the team to respond to cases in a professional manner. The process outlines exactly the steps to be taken by JOSA responders once they receive a case (in the same way that when you call 911, the first question they ask is your location, then proceed to ask other questions). This workflow is a constant work in progress, we’re leveraging our partnership with AccessNow’s helpline team (they respond to digital safety cases of human rights defenders on a global level). We hope that through this partnership we will build our team’s knowledge and capacity in emergency response. We have also launched a minimum viable product of our emergency response portal: http://er.jordanopensource.org/. The portal includes an explanation of ways we can help, what makes us trustworthy, and ways to contact us. Individuals can contact us via: a hotline number, our email address.
Establishing a trained rapid response team ready to support at risk individuals and organizations

comment.narrative: Establishing a trained rapid response team ready to support at risk individuals and organizations
Establishing a trained rapid response team ready to support at risk individuals and organizations
